titleStmt.title: Thomas S. Bronston, Jr. et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG1241

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Military Correspondence, 1862-1863

body.p:
Camp Chase Ohio Prison No 1
August 19th 1862

The undersigned peacable citizens of Kentucky would respectfully, state to his Excellency and the Legislature of Ky, that they are held as prisoners at Camp Chase Ohio; having been arrested whilst purusing their legitimate business, without warrant and without legal authority, in vilolation of law and their civil and legal rights, & forced out of the State of Ky and into this prison, where we are now held

We are unlawfully held at this place. having always been law, abiding citizens of the State of Ky, and have never committed an act of disloyalty against that State or the United States. and we are assured by the official that we can only regain our libery by proof establishing our innocence -- a principle unprecented and unknown to the law. --
We ask the charges prefered against us, demand to be confronted by our accusers and a trial by our peers in persuance of the constitutions of Ky and that of the United States. --

We therefore, would call your Excellency's attention and the consideration of the Legislature to this matter and ask of your honor and that honorable body if they approve of these proceedings and to immediately take action for our release and to prevent such proceedings in the future

Thos S Bronston Jr
W A Cunningham
Edward Stevenson
Richard Zimmerman
John S. Davis
A, H, Clements.
Robert, P, Sharp
W, B. Hardesty=
John G, Cole
James, E, Stewart
Wm Smith, Collins
J. S -- Ruppert
E. E Barnes
W. A. Withers
Isaac, Hutchison
W, A, Glass
Pharmer Lesley
Thomas Collins
S, S, Moore

Lucien B Stoker
Robert J Taylor

Dudley Justice
John W. Varney
H. Barker
William L Sullivan
G B George W, Brumbach
Bengiman F reede
George W Cobb

Hirres Gardan

Joseph Hicks
John. Con
John Kinman
Pettn from Prisoners in Camp Chase
